That’s a tricky one, I think one of the easier solutions, would be to have some JS to adjust the height of the second row to extend if your right column extended past the bottom  of the second row

I think you could also do something with CSS grid, but i’ve not used it very much as the IE11 support is iffy
<@U6GNQ7JBU> <@U22VBL87M> Is there some way to track the progress of this issue? As I move closer to production I’m really getting worried that this will cause a ruckus with a client.
I’ll do some testing. There should be a way to back-merge the template-level data into the content data
I don’t think this should be automatic as a template change could break live content accidentally
Thank you that would be much appreciated. A way to back-merge the template level data into the content data is exactly what’s needed
Yea, I don’t think they could be “automatic” or “synced” but that might be an interesting option…
Please let me know if I can help test or do anything useful to make it happen
also, <@U6GNQ7JBU> even the data back-merge feature is secondary to not being able to add new drag sections to a drag area if that drag area has ever been modified in the editor

<@UDHT6N5SM> If you want a temporary solution you could hit the API: PUT `cospages/v1/landing-pages/((id))/buffer?portalId=((portalId))`  with `{ "layoutSections": {} }` as the body while you are testing dnd areas
